posts.name: Cast Iron Kitchen
posts.note: Cast Iron Kitchen (CIK) serves North Carolina Based Southern Cuisine, seasonal and locally driven menu for brunch and breakfast is served all day. They have crafted cocktails and the boat or beach picnic packages. You should order the Not Your Momma’s Meatloaf sandwich or the shrimp and grits or chicken and waffles. From their website, 'The concept for CIK is built upon the idea of re-inventing and re-inspiring the classic idea of the Southern breakfast and/or lunch experience.  Casual elegance and Southern hospitality shines beside well thought and well executed dishes using the fresh local and North Carolina based products and services.  Emphasis on seasonal ingredients when possible, sourcing a majority of products from NC farms and companies.  Building relationships with local farmers so the menus stay fresh, consistent and ever changing. Emphasis on creative daily specials that span all Southern cuisine has to offer.  All food will be made fresh in-house daily to ensure peak freshness, recipes will be ones that have been passed down from generation to generation.'

posts.name: The Copper Penny
posts.note: The Copper Penny is an energetic saloon with nightly food and drink specials plus lots of microbrews on tap and in bottles. From their website, 'Located in historic downtown Wilmington, the Copper Penny offers an eclectic mix of appetizers, salads, and sandwiches along with an extensive selection of mixed drinks and beers.' You should order the Hot Roast Pork Sandwich that has sliced pork tenderloin, sautéed spinach, provolone cheese, fried onions, garlic aioli, served with a side of Au Jus, or the 109 Chestnut Chicken which has thinly sliced chicken topped w/ provolone, sautéed mushrooms, caramelized onions, and chipotle mayo, or their Homemade Beer-Battered Onion Rings.

posts.name: Fork N’ Cork
posts.note: Fork N’ Cork serves gourmet burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers are on the menu at this quaint, brick-walled bar with TVs. You should order the duck wings or their burgers or the patty melt or the Wellington bites that have port wine cherry sauce. From the Carolinas Eater website, 'An appearance on Guy Fieri’s Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives helped rocket the Fork ‘N’ Cork to national attention. Fieri raved about the confit duck wings, but the downtown Wilmington restaurant (which also has an outpost at Carolina Beach) has long been a favorite with locals. Two styles of poutine (classic and Texas, with smoked brisket and barbecue sauce), fried pickles, and Rattlesnake Bites (roasted jalapenos stuffed with shrimp, corn, cheese, and then deep-fried) accompany an extensive list of burgers and sandwiches.'

posts.name: Seabird
posts.note: From their website, ‘Set in a historic building in downtown Wilmington, Seabird celebrates the seasonality of the seafood and ingredients found in North Carolina and its storied coast. Beer, wine, and handcrafted cocktails will be enjoyed by all alongside oysters and shellfish caught by local, small-scale fishermen. As sure as the changing tide, Seabird’s menu will push the conversation forward on procuring local seafood and celebrate the seasonality while finding the best methods in fishing, aquaculture, and farming. The food will be creative, seasonal, fresh, and uniquely Wilmington.’ From the Carolina Eater website, ‘After taking flight in spring 2021, Seabird has quickly soared to the top of Wilmington’s restaurant scene. The creation of local fixtures Lydia Clopton and Dean Neff, the restaurant is now open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. A nautically inspired interior is the setting for Neff’s creative menu that is heavy on seafood, like the swordfish schnitzel, a seasonal seafood tower, and a smoked catfish and oyster pie. The cozy bar transforms into a counter-service coffee, breakfast, and lunch scene each morning with sandwiches, soups, pastries, and more.’ You can customize your display and select which columns you would like to see. In this example, the Invoice Number was removed, so the viewer no longer has that column displayed.

posts.name: Something Fishy Seafood
posts.note: Something Fishy Seafood is a down-home seafood shack dishing up generous servings of clams, shrimp, and more in old-school digs. You need to order the seafood platter which has seven types of fried seafood items which probably could feed two people or more. From the Carolina Beach website, 'Something Fishy Seafood Restaurant is a back-to-basics seafood shack that’s found in central Wilmington along a quieter and less bustling section of College Road. Found within a modest sized but distinctive bright yellow and blue diner-style building, the menu may be simple, but the warm interior, friendly service, and local specialties set this seafood joint apart.

posts.name: Sweet n Savory Cafe
posts.note: Sweet n Savory Cafe has bright murals which adorn this cheery cafe with all-day American eats, an on-site bakery, and outdoor seats. You should order the Wrightsville Beach French Toast two thick slices of cinnamon raisin bread dunked in their house batter and fried to perfection with strawberries and blueberries with whip cream or the Mutha Heffer which is their meatloaf sandwich with candied bacon, onion straws, tomato jam, dijonnaise, arugula on texas toast. From the Food Network website, 'Open for breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner, Sweet n Savory Cafe is a must-try option while passing through Wilmington. The menu includes something for everyone, with classic dishes (pot roast, chicken pot pie, meatloaf, etc.) and incredible creations from the restaurant's Executive chef and Sous chef. They recommend ordering the Wrightsville Beach French Toast and Mutha Heffer Sandwich (Meatloaf Sandwich).'
